Identity.History: The Irish wolfhound is the tallest dog breed known today with males reaching up to 32 inches (81 cm) tall at the shoulder. The Irish wolfhound is an ancient breed kept both in Ireland and Britain. It was bred for one thing: hunting wolves. The hounds were so successful at this that in Ireland the wolf is extinct. The Irish wolfhound has a shaggy coat, which is usually gray but can also be black, red, or brown.
